unnormalised: The BSE Sensex experienced a volatile trading session today, closing at 76,456.65, a marginal increase of 0.02% . Market analysts attributed the fluctuations to global cues and profit booking by investors. Nifty 50 also mirrored this trend, settling at 23,264.85.
normalised: The B-S-E Sensex experienced a volatile trading session today, closing at seventy six thousand four hundred and fifty six point six five, a marginal increase of zero point zero two percent. Market analysts attributed the fluctuations to global cues and profit booking by investors. Nifty fifty also mirrored this trend, settling at twenty three thousand two hundred and sixty four point eight five.

unnormalised: Key gainers included Reliance Industries (up 1.5%) and HDFC Bank (up 0.8%), while Tata Steel and ICICI Bank witnessed declines of 2.3% and 1.7% respectively. Foreign Institutional Investors (FIIs) remained net buyers, with inflows of Rs. 1200 crores, while Domestic Institutional Investors (DIIs) were net sellers at Rs. 850 crores.
normalised: Key gainers included Reliance Industries (up one point five percent) and H-D-F-C Bank (up zero point eight percent), while Tata Steel and I-C-I-C-I Bank witnessed declines of two point three percent and one point seven percent respectively. Foreign Institutional Investors (F-I-I-s) remained net buyers, with inflows of rupee one thousand two hundred crores, while Domestic Institutional Investors (D-I-I-s) were net sellers at rupee eight hundred and fifty crores.

unnormalised: Experts advise investors to remain cautious, given the prevailing market conditions. The next trading session on 27/06/2024 is expected to be influenced by the release of key economic data and global market trends. The Rupee traded at 83.50 against the USD.
normalised: Experts advise investors to remain cautious, given the prevailing market conditions.
